Title: Analista de Datos
Description:
Desde Grupo Planeta nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un/a Analista de Datos para apoyar el crecimiento a nivel nacional e internacional, en el departamento de Admisiones. Esta posición es nuestra OBS Business School, perteneciente a la división de Planeta Formación y Universidades.

¿Cuál será tu misión?


Dominar nuestra herramienta de gestión de candidatos para la extracción de información.
Gestionar la información comercial disponible en el Departamento de Admisiones a fin de generar los reportes necesarios para el correcto seguimiento de indicadores.
Analizar los procesos existentes en los cuales se recopilan datos para proponer una optimización sustentada en la planificación a desarrollar con los estándares que permita el contexto de negocio y las herramientas disponibles.
Dar visibilidad de toda la información del departamento con diferentes Dashboard.
Dar soporte en el proceso de toma de decisiones estratégicas del área proporcionando datos fiables a partir de la información recopilada.



¿Cuáles serían tus principales funciones?


Dominio del proceso en nuestro CRM
Creación, optimización y propuesta de circuitos
Identificación y creación de KPI’s
Optimización y gestión de BBDD
Realizar Dashboard (cuadros de mando) fiables
Reportes: diarios, semanales y mensuales



Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?


Experiencia en modelos de datos
Dominio muy avanzado de Excel
Dominio muy avanzado de Power BI, herramienta clave para los reportes
BBDD: Extracción-Transformación-Visualización-Carga (ETL)
Se valorarán favorablemente conocimientos en: PYTHON, SQL, QLIK, R



Encajarías con nosotros/as si consideras que eres una persona con:


Proactividad, resolutivo, aporte ideas y soluciones
Exigente, metódico
Anticipación problemas
Facilitador de toma de decisiones
Analítico, atención al detalle, estructurado
Confiable
Visión de negocio



¿Qué ofrecemos?


Buen ambiente de trabajo con un equipo joven y dinámico.
Plan de desarrollo profesional.
Posibilidad de crecimiento transversal en nuestras líneas de negocio & marcas.
Plan de Retribución Flexible
Plan de compensación y beneficios de Grupo Planeta.
Jornada completa.
Horario de lunes a jueves 9:00h a 18:30h, viernes de 9:00h a 15:00h.
Ubicación: Barcelona (Hospitalet).



Si crees que es tu oportunidad laboral, ¡Te animamos a inscribirte y formar parte de nuestro equipo!
Show more
HTML:
Desde Grupo Planeta nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un/a Analista de Datos para apoyar el crecimiento a nivel nacional e internacional, en el departamento de Admisiones. Esta posición es nuestra OBS Business School, perteneciente a la división de Planeta Formación y Universidades.

¿Cuál será tu misión?

  • Dominar nuestra herramienta de gestión de candidatos para la extracción de información.
  • Gestionar la información comercial disponible en el Departamento de Admisiones a fin de generar los reportes necesarios para el correcto seguimiento de indicadores.
  • Analizar los procesos existentes en los cuales se recopilan datos para proponer una optimización sustentada en la planificación a desarrollar con los estándares que permita el contexto de negocio y las herramientas disponibles.
  • Dar visibilidad de toda la información del departamento con diferentes Dashboard.
  • Dar soporte en el proceso de toma de decisiones estratégicas del área proporcionando datos fiables a partir de la información recopilada.


¿Cuáles serían tus principales funciones?

  • Dominio del proceso en nuestro CRM
  • Creación, optimización y propuesta de circuitos
  • Identificación y creación de KPI’s
  • Optimización y gestión de BBDD
  • Realizar Dashboard (cuadros de mando) fiables
  • Reportes: diarios, semanales y mensuales


Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?

  • Experiencia en modelos de datos
  • Dominio muy avanzado de Excel
  • Dominio muy avanzado de Power BI, herramienta clave para los reportes
  • BBDD: Extracción-Transformación-Visualización-Carga (ETL)
  • Se valorarán favorablemente conocimientos en: PYTHON, SQL, QLIK, R


Encajarías con nosotros/as si consideras que eres una persona con:

  • Proactividad, resolutivo, aporte ideas y soluciones
  • Exigente, metódico
  • Anticipación problemas
  • Facilitador de toma de decisiones
  • Analítico, atención al detalle, estructurado
  • Confiable
  • Visión de negocio


¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Buen ambiente de trabajo con un equipo joven y dinámico.
  • Plan de desarrollo profesional.
  • Posibilidad de crecimiento transversal en nuestras líneas de negocio & marcas.
  • Plan de Retribución Flexible
  • Plan de compensación y beneficios de Grupo Planeta.
  • Jornada completa.
  • Horario de lunes a jueves 9:00h a 18:30h, viernes de 9:00h a 15:00h.
  • Ubicación: Barcelona (Hospitalet).


Si crees que es tu oportunidad laboral, ¡Te animamos a inscribirte y formar parte de nuestro equipo!

Title: Data Analyst for Commercial Risk Processes (m/f/d)
Description:
Location:

Barcelona, ES, 08021

Onsite/Hybrid/Remote: Hybrid (< 50% remote)

The planet has unlimited energy sources such as the sun, wind, and water. One of the greatest challenges of our era is the large-scale development of the potential of these sources. ENERCON has accepted this challenge.

As a pioneer of wind energy technology and a partner of the energy transition, ENERCON specialises in the turbine and technology development, production, sales and servicing of onshore wind turbines. Pursuing its mission of ‘Energy for the world’, ENERCON has driven sustainable energy generation from onshore wind since 1984. Thanks to its innovative wind turbine technology, high quality standards and a total installed power of more than 61 GW, it is one of the world’s leading manufacturers.

At ENERCON we are passionate about realizing wind energy projects across the globe and meeting tomorrow's energy technology challenges. Supported by our headquarters in Aurich (Germany), around 13,000 professionals spread all around the world contribute with their engagement to shape the future of renewable energies. You may join us and contribute too.

To join our Team in Barcelona, we are looking for a:

Data Analyst for Commercial Risk Processes (m/f/d)

Our team in Barcelona is part of the ENERCON Southern Europe and Latin America (SELA) regional team. With 2.500 dedicated professionals, more than 4,867 installed wind turbines, equivalent to 9.5 GW of installed capacity and presence across Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay, Costa Rica, Portugal, Spain, Italy, and Greece, we are a significant player in these markets.

At ENERCON, we firmly believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion not only enrich our team but also drive our capacity for innovation. We value each person for their skills and experience, actively promoting the integration of qualified individuals regardless of their gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnic origin, religion, nationality, disability, or age. We are committed to ensuring a work environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their competencies and knowledge, free from prejudice and discrimination. For us, inclusion is not just a policy but a daily practice that fosters collective growth and allows us to reach our full potential as a team.

The COE department drives sales and after-sales performance by optimizing processes and mitigating risks, ensuring efficiency and resilience. This role involves developing Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and dashboards using PowerBI or SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to monitor and optimize these processes.

Your Tasks


Develop dashboards to monitor/optimize processes using PowerBI or SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).
Respond to ad-hoc analytical needs.
Propose Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure the risk level of sales processes.
Adapt dashboards to cater to different audiences, ensuring clarity and relevance.
Capture the essence of databases and extract key information for meaningful insights.
Own key-user meetings to capture feedback on existing processes.
Maintain process tools for sales (SAP, excel, sharepoint, powerpoint) updated and aligned across different platforms.
Improve Enercon’s data quality.


Your Qualifications


Degree in Business, Data/Business Analytics, Data science, Finance, Engineering.
Proficiency in Data Analysis Tools: Excel, Python, DAX.
Experience with Data Visualization Tools: Power BI (needed), SAC is a plus.
Experience with SAP is a plus.
Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, perform ad-hoc analyses quickly and provide actionable insights.
Attention to Detail: Ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent data visualization skills, with the ability to tailor presentations/dashboards to various audiences.
Excellent communication skills in English, German is a plus.


Your Benefits


Friendly and challenging working environment.
Opportunity for professional growth in an international environment.
Flexible and hybrid working systems to support your life balance.
Competitive remuneration package.
Life & medical insurances.
Meal card.
Fitness promotion programme.


Ready for this challenge, please resgister and enclose your CV and a motivation letter tailored to the fulfillment of the above responsibilities and profile.

Data Analyst for Commercial Risk Processes (m/f/d) Location: Barcelona

Title: Analista de Negocio (Data Analyst)
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Occident, una de las empresas con mayor relevancia en el sector asegurador español, está emprendiendo, desde su departamento de Analítica de Negocio, la transformación de la organización hacia un modelo data-centric.




En este contexto, el departamento de Analítica de Negocio fomenta el desarrollo y la aplicación de modelos de Inteligencia Artificial para la resolución de problemas y mejora de procesos de negocio en la compañía.

Dentro de este departamento, estamos buscando la incorporación de un estudiante con interés en el área de la Inteligencia Artificial con la finalidad de colaborar con el equipo en un rol de analista de negocio. Este rol consistirá en entender las problemáticas de los equipos de negocio de la compañía para encontrar soluciones tecnológicas, basadas en el uso de datos, que ayuden a la mejora de sus procesos.




Requisitos:

Se busca una persona con pensamiento crítico y habilidades para la resolución de problemas.
Persona proactiva, participativa, con capacidad de trabajo en equipo y ganas de aprender dentro de un área en constante evolución.
Capacidad de abstracción y conceptualización de conceptos difusos.
Conocimientos avanzados de estadística/matemáticas
Conocimientos en jurisprudencia y teorías sociológicas para comprender y analizar el impacto de las políticas y regulaciones en el sector asegurador.
Conocimientos básicos de programación (Python/R/SQL recomendables)
Conocimientos básicos de Machine Learning / Deep Learning




Dedicación:

Reflexión y propuesta de ideas para solucionar problemáticas empresariales con el uso de datos y algoritmos de Machine Learning.
Autonomía para conceptualizar problemas en propuestas de datos concretas de aplicación a negocio.
Análisis y derivación de información útil en base a los sistemas de datos de la compañía.
Aplicación y transformación adecuada de la información para alimentar modelos de Machine Learning.
Evaluación tangible de las soluciones de datos propuestas.
Interrelación con diferentes departamentos de la compañía.




La oferta incluye:

Formación en diversos aspectos de Machine Learning.
Formación en aspectos como "Critical Thinking" o "Problem Solving"
Jornada 25 h/semana.
Horario flexible adaptado a las necesidades del estudiante.
Teletrabajo 3 días semanales.
Retribución bruta de 10€/h.
Posibilidad de realizar el TFG/TFM si la colaboración se prolonga más de un semestre.
Posibilidad de incorporación finalizado el convenio de prácticas.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:


Design, develop, reports and dashboards
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices


Continuous Improvement & Documentation:


Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.


Data Quality & Validation:


Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.


Support the Finance team’s evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools

Accompany users to change

Process changes and corrective maintenance

Support IT Data & Analytics operating model

Create Data Analytics key users’ community within the BU

Professional Experience

You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau® (certification), Power BI, and Excel.

Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus

Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Personal Attributes

Innovative spirit and interest in company processes

Solution oriented mindset

Drive to continuously improve your area

High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability

Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner

Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences

Team player with good communication skills

Excellent level in English (French is a plus)

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.

Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Visualization - PowerBI
Description:
En BETWEEN apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del sector tecnológico. Nos involucramos en una gran variedad de proyectos punteros, trabajando con las últimas tecnologías. Actualmente, en BETWEEN contamos con un equipo de más de 1000 personas.

Trabajamos en ámbitos como BI, IoT, Big Data e I+D. En el área de Operaciones implantamos proyectos de Service Desk, Infraestructuras IT y proyectos Cloud, entre otros.

Actualmente, seleccionamos un/a Data Visualizator de BI para incorporarse de forma indefinida en uno de los equipos que Between tiene implantados en uno de nuestros principales clientes.

¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:


Diseñar y crear gráficos y dashboards interactivos para visualizar datos de forma clara.
Uso de herramientas PowerBI.
Trabajar con equipos de negocio y tecnologías para entender mejor los datos.
Limpiar y organiza datos para que sean precisos y útiles.
Optimización de informes para que sean más agiles.


¿Cómo lo haré? Tendrás a tu alcance:


Metodologías ágiles de trabajo (Scrum, Kanban, Agile)
Modalidad híbrida (1 día de presencialidad cada dos semanas).


Si Eres BETWEENER Obtendrás Estos Beneficios


Seguro médico con Sanitas.
Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional: Idiomas, cursos en Udemy, Certificaciones, Programa The Power Business School y Bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).
Contarás con un equipo de Talento que te acompañará durante toda tu experiencia con nosotros. ¡Haremos un café una vez al mes! Así, mantendremos el contacto.
Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible (Ticket restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería).
Descuentos para acceder a centros de Fitness con Gympass.
Acceso a nuestro Club de Descuentos: Inspiring Benefits.
En BETWEEN nos gusta mucho hacer networking, por lo que te invitaremos a participar en todos estos eventos ¡y más!: las BETWEEN Nights, torneos deportivos, Black Mamba Race, viernes de vermut, juegos de mesa, etc.
Programa remunerado de recomendación de Talento.
En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.


Requisitos

Imprescindible:


Grado universitario de Informática o similar.
Experiencia con PowerBI, SQL
Conocimientos en de DBT (Data build tool)
BBDD: sql, Oracle, Postgresql, etc.


Muy Valorable


Airflow
Disponer de certificaciones en las tecnologías indicadas
Show more

Title: Intern Global E-Commerce Data Analyst - English Speaker
Description:
About this Position Are you a curious, data driven and energetic individual willing to solve critical challenges with passion and innovation? Are you seeking to be the connection between our internal international teams and agencies? If this sounds like you, keep reading! Successful candidate will be part of our E-commerce Global team that defines, develops, and executes the eCommerce strategy for Henkel Consumer Adhesives.

What You´ll Do


Support Ecom global team in the roll-out of data usage and strategies across countries.
Deliver high quality reports and analysis for our stakeholders (global teams)
Tracks, processes, analyses and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.
Regular trend research and competitive analyses.
Own set of responsibilities for one or several projects.


What makes you a good fit


Degree in controlling, statistics, information science, mathematics or similar.
Excellent knowledge of English
Very good command of MS Office, specifically Excel & analytical skills is required
Hands-on experience with common visualization tools is a plus, such as Power BI, Tableau or others
Goal oriented working-style, reliable in project management
Initiative team player who enjoys working in a challenging and exciting environment
Good interpersonal and communication skills


Some perks of joining Henkel


Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid and work from anywhere policies
Diverse national and international growth opportunities
Meal Allowance for each worked day
Discounts on company products


At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern in GCS
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

The Team

Global Customer Support (GCS) is the global organization responsible for Technical Services in the Diagnostics Division, which ensures end-user success. GCS supports the service organizations of the Roche affiliates and the Lifecycle Teams.

The GCS Project & Portfolio Excellence Organizational Effectiveness team empowers the service & support community through data-driven co-created insights to successfully and sustainably enhance service efficiency while ensuring customer satisfaction.

The Role

The Service Data Analyst Intern will support the Service Analytics team in developing and maintaining data-driven solutions, such as dashboards and reports, to provide actionable insights for the entire Service Organization. This internship provides hands-on experience with data visualization tools, data analysis, and collaboration with cross-functional and international teams. The intern will work closely with experienced analysts, contributing to the development of service analytics while gaining exposure to best practices in data visualization, governance, and stakeholder engagement.

Your Key Responsibilities

Assist in the development of Service Analytics solutions (Tableau Dashboards, Reports…):
Support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and reports to provide insights to stakeholders
Ensure data visualizations are clear, accurate, and aligned with business needs
Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data reliability and proper governance
Assist in promoting self-service analytics solutions across the organization
Document processes and provide training materials for data consumers
Perform data analysis and insights generation:
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns
Support senior analysts in preparing reports and presentations for stakeholders
Engage in team collaboration and learning:
Work in a collaborative and supportive team environment, sharing knowledge and learning from senior analysts
Adhere to established best practices in analytics and data visualization
Participate in discussions to improve service analytics processes and efficiency
Seek mentorship and professional development opportunities within the team
Support stakeholder engagement and business partnering:
Assist in gathering and understanding data requirements from stakeholders
Help prepare and present reports to business units such as GCS managers, regional leads, and affiliates
Contribute to projects from conception to completion, ensuring alignment with business objectives

Who You Are:

We are looking for someone self-motivated, really passionate about his or her job, and understands that providing a high-quality service is crucial for the organization. Apply if you are


Studies background from a university and recent graduate -no more than 3 years- in the fields of Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field..
Strong communicator in English at full professional proficiency
Some experience in data analysis, visualization, or related areas (academic projects or internships preferred)
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Thoughtspot, Power BI, Looker)
Understanding of SQL and data manipulation; familiarity with Python or R is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Good communication skills to interact with stakeholders and present findings clearly
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and demonstrate a willingness to learn
A team player who truly believes that together we can go further
Not afraid to fail and learn
Comfort with uncertainty
We are offering a one-year contract starting ideally from May 2025


Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Wallapop is a Barcelona based scale-up driven by the purpose to empower people to embrace a more conscious and human way of consumption. We believe in a world where collaborative economy is mainstream. This is what drives us. 💫

Wallapop operates in Spain, Italy and Portugal, offering a catalogue of several hundreds of millions of products and services. Powered by technical innovation and continuous improvement, we bring together the scale & trust of classifieds with the marketplace's convenience & reach. 🌱 Our mission is to enable a connected trade ecosystem, making 2nd-hand the norm through smart use of technology.

Backed by top investors such as Accel, Insight Partners & Naver Corp we bring our total valuation to 806 million EUR and are embarking on our international journey with the aim to become the world's best unique goods trading platform.

The Challenge 🧩

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for working with large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. You will transform data-driven insights into strategic recommendations for stakeholders at all levels, ranging from product teams to tribe leads and company leadership. Collaborating closely with Product, Marketing, Data, and Tech teams, you will design and execute experiments, conduct quantitative research, and ensure continuous access to high-quality data and insightful visualizations.

What You Will Do 👇


Developing metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance measurement frameworks.
Identifying growth opportunities through data trends using time-series analysis and predictive modeling.
Extracting quantitative insights from data, and translating them into actionable recommendations to address knowledge gaps and drive business impact.
Creating and managing dashboards, enabling easy data access for the stakeholders.
Maintaining data pipelines to ensure efficient data flow and accessibility, and ensuring data quality.
Designing, executing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product features or marketing strategies.
Conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data characteristics, user segments and market evolution.
Contributing to high-quality documentation for metrics, analyses and data models.
Promoting data literacy and a data-driven mindset within the team and the organization.


What We're Looking For 🔎


Proven experience in a Data Analyst role, preferably in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.
Expert-level proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in defining and implementing metrics and data models.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, methodologies, and their practical applications.
Proactive and collaborative mindset, with a proven ability to work effectively across cross-functional teams.
Passion for data and a strong commitment to data-driven decision-making.


What Would Be A Plus 🚀


Familiarity with Data Warehousing and ETL processes.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R.
Proficiency with version control systems, particularly Git.
Basic experience in training and applying Machine Learning models and techniques
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Domain expertise in marketplaces or classifieds.
Exposure to qualitative research methodologies.


Do note that all our jobs are 📍 Barcelona based. We follow a hybrid model where flexibility rules. We commit to a minimum of 6 days per month in the office. Each team self-organizes to decide on cadence and in-person/remote rituals.

Wallapop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.

Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following 🍭 Perks & Benefits:


Competitive phantom shares package for all employees
Generous individual learning budget of 2k per year
Group and individual English, Catalan & Spanish lessons as part of our working day
Private Health Insurance with Alan
Flexible working hours + intensive Fridays
Flexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)
Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the office
Generous referral Program & Charity Donation
Bonus for weddings & newborns
Wallapop Renta (Tax income support)
Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our services
Work anniversary Gifts and Birthday Surprises
Contribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payroll
One-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your home office
Relocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable
26 holidays per year
TOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)


What does the hiring process for this position look like? 👀**Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**

Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation, and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.

Online test - you will be sent a coding test to assess your analytical skills.

Case Study Submission - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your expertise / technical skills required for the role.

Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60-90 minutes.

Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Culture Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.
Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Somos una compañía global, líder en el desarrollo de infraestructuras regenerativas que generan un impacto positivo en la sociedad. Nuestra plantilla, formada por más de 65.000 profesionales y presente en más de 40 países de los cinco continentes, contribuye a nuestra misión de diseñar un planeta mejor. Buscamos personas que quieran marcar la diferencia, promover el desarrollo sostenible y encontrar soluciones a los mayores desafíos globales, incluidos el cambio climático, la sobrepoblación y la escasez hídrica. Únete a nosotros en la búsqueda de soluciones para lograr un futuro sostenible.

Descripción del puesto

El/La Data Analyst será responsable de la construcción y mantenimiento de dashboards en PowerBI, la definición y gestión de KPIs y la creación de data products para apoyar la toma de decisiones del negocio. Además, liderará la identificación, documentación y migración de los servicios de datos actuales hacia una nueva arquitectura medallón en GCP, asegurando la trazabilidad y gobernanza de los datos.

Requisitos del candidato

PRINCIPALES FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES


Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards en Power BI que proporcionen información clave para las áreas de negocio.
Identificar y documentar los servicios de datos existentes (CdM, dashboards, KPIs, informes), asegurando la trazabilidad y calidad de los datos.
Liderar la migración de los servicios de datos actuales a una arquitectura medallón en GCP, garantizando la continuidad y optimización del análisis de datos.
Actuar como interfaz con las áreas de negocio para entender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en soluciones de datos efectivas.
Colaborar con el Data Engineer en el diseño y modelado de datamarts optimizados para la explotación en Power BI.
Impulsar la gobernanza de datos en la empresa mediante la construcción de un Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.


PERFIL DE LA PERSONA


Formación reglada: Ingeniería informática o similar.
Formación no reglada / Complementaria: Sólidos conocimientos de modelados de datos y definición de datamarts en entornos analíticos. Conocimiento de arquitecturas de datos modernas, preferiblemente en Google Cloud Platform, y experiencia en migraciones de datos. Conocimientos en Data Governance, con capacidad para estructurar y construir en Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.
Experiencia: Más de 5 años en posición similar. Experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo de dashboards y modelos de datos en Power BI. Experiencia en la documentación de flujos de datos, trazabilidad y gobernanza de datos. Experiencia en SQL y herramientas ETL para transformación y análisis de datos será valorada.
Otros: Persona organizada, con iniciativa y sentido de la responsabilidad. Acostumbrada a trabajar en ambientes laborales dinámicos. Habilidades de análisis y comunicación para interactuar con steakholders de negocio y entender sus necesidades. Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma como el único Data Analyst de la Compañía, con visión estratégica y enfoque a resultados.


Somos una compañía que valora la diversidad como fuente de talento y por ello trabajamos para impulsar un entorno inclusivo en el que se promueve el respeto, la pertenencia y el compromiso de forma que todas las personas puedan participar en igualdad de oportunidades. Invitamos a todas las personas a inscribirse con independencia del origen, circunstancias, bagaje o condición. ACCIONA ha recibido la certificación Top Employer 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024 y 2025, que reconoce a la Compañía como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España.
Show more
HTML:
Somos una compañía global, líder en el desarrollo de infraestructuras regenerativas que generan un impacto positivo en la sociedad. Nuestra plantilla, formada por más de 65.000 profesionales y presente en más de 40 países de los cinco continentes, contribuye a nuestra misión de diseñar un planeta mejor. Buscamos personas que quieran marcar la diferencia, promover el desarrollo sostenible y encontrar soluciones a los mayores desafíos globales, incluidos el cambio climático, la sobrepoblación y la escasez hídrica. Únete a nosotros en la búsqueda de soluciones para lograr un futuro sostenible.

Descripción del puesto

El/La Data Analyst será responsable de la construcción y mantenimiento de dashboards en PowerBI, la definición y gestión de KPIs y la creación de data products para apoyar la toma de decisiones del negocio. Además, liderará la identificación, documentación y migración de los servicios de datos actuales hacia una nueva arquitectura medallón en GCP, asegurando la trazabilidad y gobernanza de los datos.

Requisitos del candidato

PRINCIPALES FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES

  • Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards en Power BI que proporcionen información clave para las áreas de negocio.
  • Identificar y documentar los servicios de datos existentes (CdM, dashboards, KPIs, informes), asegurando la trazabilidad y calidad de los datos.
  • Liderar la migración de los servicios de datos actuales a una arquitectura medallón en GCP, garantizando la continuidad y optimización del análisis de datos.
  • Actuar como interfaz con las áreas de negocio para entender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en soluciones de datos efectivas.
  • Colaborar con el Data Engineer en el diseño y modelado de datamarts optimizados para la explotación en Power BI.
  • Impulsar la gobernanza de datos en la empresa mediante la construcción de un Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.

PERFIL DE LA PERSONA

  • Formación reglada: Ingeniería informática o similar.
  • Formación no reglada / Complementaria: Sólidos conocimientos de modelados de datos y definición de datamarts en entornos analíticos. Conocimiento de arquitecturas de datos modernas, preferiblemente en Google Cloud Platform, y experiencia en migraciones de datos. Conocimientos en Data Governance, con capacidad para estructurar y construir en Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.
  • Experiencia: Más de 5 años en posición similar. Experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo de dashboards y modelos de datos en Power BI. Experiencia en la documentación de flujos de datos, trazabilidad y gobernanza de datos. Experiencia en SQL y herramientas ETL para transformación y análisis de datos será valorada.
  • Otros: Persona organizada, con iniciativa y sentido de la responsabilidad. Acostumbrada a trabajar en ambientes laborales dinámicos. Habilidades de análisis y comunicación para interactuar con steakholders de negocio y entender sus necesidades. Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma como el único Data Analyst de la Compañía, con visión estratégica y enfoque a resultados.

Somos una compañía que valora la diversidad como fuente de talento y por ello trabajamos para impulsar un entorno inclusivo en el que se promueve el respeto, la pertenencia y el compromiso de forma que todas las personas puedan participar en igualdad de oportunidades. Invitamos a todas las personas a inscribirse con independencia del origen, circunstancias, bagaje o condición. ACCIONA ha recibido la certificación Top Employer 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024 y 2025, que reconoce a la Compañía como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España.

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo’s high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark…)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers’ performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization…)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams…) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years’ experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy…)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data – we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you’ll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry’s top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city’s best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We’d love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.


Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company



Your work environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. Title: Data Analyst – Teletrabajo híbrido
Description:
¿Te interesaría seguir desarrollándote como Data Analyst en una en una empresa líder del sector transporte en un entorno colaborativo, jerarquía plana y con proyección laboral?




Desde Oxigent Technologies seleccionamos un/a ANALISTA DE DATOS cuya misión será dar sentido a los datos y transformarlos en información útil para la toma de decisiones de las áreas de negocio así como entender las necesidades del cliente interno y liderar dentro de su equipo de trabajo la creación de reportes y herramientas que mejor apoyen y ayuden en la visualización de la información.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?

• Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos efectivas (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos) dando sentido al flujo de análisis y storytelling que ayude a las áreas de negocio.

• Liderar junto con el Product Owner las relaciones con los equipos de negocio (comerciales y/o de operaciones), para asegurar un pleno entendimiento del área.

• Apoyar a su equipo en la resolución de problemas y desafíos relacionados con reportería y análisis de la información, teniendo una mirada crítica e impulsando

las mejores prácticas del uso y consumo de datos.

• Velar por el cumplimiento de los estándares de trabajo, procesos y correcta utilización de herramientas definidos desde el equipo de central de Business Insights, para asegurar procesos eficientes y escalables.




Para ello, ¿qué vas a necesitar?

• Tener mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de datos utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau o PowerBI

• Experiencia con lenguaje de consulta de datos (SQL) y/o Software estadisticos/matematicos (R, Python...)

• Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería. Se valorará estudios de Máster/MBA.

• Pensamiento crítico y habilidades de Problem Solving: capacidad de entender un problema, imaginar una solución y estructurarla




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

• Contratación indefinida a través de Oxigent.

• Salario acorde a la experiencia aportada (entre 30.000 - 46.000 euros brutos anuales).

• Horario flexible y jornada intensiva.

• Modelo híbrido (3 días remoto- 2 días en oficina) - Oficinas en Barcelona

• Cheque Formación para desarrollarte en las áreas profesionales que más te interesen.

• Seguro médico privado.

• Retribución flexible aplicable a seguro médico, restaurante, transporte, guardería y formación.

• Aplicación de acceso a gimnasios y actividades deportivas en toda España con descuentos.

• ¡Y muchos otros beneficios!

Show more
HTML:
¿Te interesaría seguir desarrollándote como Data Analyst en una en una empresa líder del sector transporte en un entorno colaborativo, jerarquía plana y con proyección laboral?


Desde Oxigent Technologies seleccionamos un/a ANALISTA DE DATOS cuya misión será dar sentido a los datos y transformarlos en información útil para la toma de decisiones de las áreas de negocio así como entender las necesidades del cliente interno y liderar dentro de su equipo de trabajo la creación de reportes y herramientas que mejor apoyen y ayuden en la visualización de la información.


¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?

• Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos efectivas (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos) dando sentido al flujo de análisis y storytelling que ayude a las áreas de negocio.

• Liderar junto con el Product Owner las relaciones con los equipos de negocio (comerciales y/o de operaciones), para asegurar un pleno entendimiento del área.

• Apoyar a su equipo en la resolución de problemas y desafíos relacionados con reportería y análisis de la información, teniendo una mirada crítica e impulsando

las mejores prácticas del uso y consumo de datos.

• Velar por el cumplimiento de los estándares de trabajo, procesos y correcta utilización de herramientas definidos desde el equipo de central de Business Insights, para asegurar procesos eficientes y escalables.


Para ello, ¿qué vas a necesitar?

• Tener mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de datos utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau o PowerBI

• Experiencia con lenguaje de consulta de datos (SQL) y/o Software estadisticos/matematicos (R, Python...)

• Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería. Se valorará estudios de Máster/MBA.

• Pensamiento crítico y habilidades de Problem Solving: capacidad de entender un problema, imaginar una solución y estructurarla


¿Qué te ofrecemos?

• Contratación indefinida a través de Oxigent.

• Salario acorde a la experiencia aportada (entre 30.000 - 46.000 euros brutos anuales).

• Horario flexible y jornada intensiva.

• Modelo híbrido (3 días remoto- 2 días en oficina) - Oficinas en Barcelona

• Cheque Formación para desarrollarte en las áreas profesionales que más te interesen.

• Seguro médico privado.

• Retribución flexible aplicable a seguro médico, restaurante, transporte, guardería y formación.

• Aplicación de acceso a gimnasios y actividades deportivas en toda España con descuentos.

• ¡Y muchos otros beneficios!

Title: Data Analyst (Adobe Analytics)
Description:
The purpose of this role is to deliver analysis inline with client business objectives, goals, and to maintain, develop and exceed client performance targets.

Job Description:

¡Hola, somos Merkle! Una compañía especializada en Customer Experience Management, que forma parte del grupo global de comunicación dentsu.

Ayudamos a empresas IBEX35, grandes anunciantes y compañías Fortune 500 a desarrollar experiencias de clientes únicas y personales a través de los datos, la tecnología y la creatividad.

Poseemos capacidades únicas en Customer Experience, Data Management e Intelligence Analytics. Al tiempo que incorporamos la visión estratégica a nuestro alto grado de especialización creando una manera de trabajar única con nuestros clientes.

 

Con sede en Madrid, Barcelona y Gijón, la base del liderazgo de Merkle lo forman las personas. Un EQUIPO de TALENTO DIGITAL formado por profesionales con gran pasión, ilusión y potencial en su trabajo.

Job Description

¿Buscas crecer personal y profesionalmente? ¿Buscas desarrollar tu carrera en un entorno joven y amigable junto a un fantástico equipo que te comprende y habla tu mismo idioma? ¿Quieres participar en un proyecto motivador, diferente, lleno de retos y desafíos que te harán salir de tu zona de confort?

Buscamos personas motivadas, que se propongan retos y que se sientan cómodas trabajando en equipo y proponiendo nuevas formas de hacer las cosas. Personas que disfruten del trato con el cliente en un ambiente donde los datos nos rodean y la interpretación de los mismos es nuestro arte.

Tus funciones consistirán en:


Diseñar y analizar KPIs.
Transformar datos en insights accionables para el negocio.
Acompañar al cliente hacia una cultura data-driven para mejorar sus estrategias.
Optimizar campañas digitales y procesos de conversión.
Traducir las necesidades de negocio de los clientes a los requerimientos técnicos de las herramientas de análisis.
Identificar y analizar datos relevantes sobre los usuarios (customer data, procesos de conversión, audiencias y campañas digitales) en los proyectos y servicios asignados, así como validar y diseñar hipótesis.
Dar soporte y resolver incidencias a nivel de configuración de herramienta de análisis digital.
Detectar sinergias y coordinar tareas con otros departamentos y stakeholders implicados.
Dominar y poner en marcha proyectos de Visualización Avanzada.
Gestionar y coordinar proyectos de analítica digital, con capacidad de priorizar tareas y detectar desviaciones.
Presentar conclusiones de análisis a los equipos de negocio.



Te ofrecemos un puesto de trabajo estable, de futuro, con posibilidad de promoción interna.

Trabajamos con clientes grandes, líderes en su sector y con un alto grado de madurez digital.

Queremos que te sientas a gusto por lo que fomentamos actividades de cohesión interna para sentirnos más equipo.

Te daremos formación inicial y formación continua, aunque tu espíritu de buscar por ti mismo y tus ganas de aprender debe ser algo que marque tu desarrollo profesional con nosotros.

¿Te unes al equipo? Te esperamos!!

Qualifications

Nos gustaría que tu formación mínima fuera una diplomatura/licenciatura de negocio (ADE, económicas, Marketing, publicidad, etc.).

Lo ideal es que tengas experiencia en proyectos de ámbito digital, concretamente en analítica de datos, así como orientación al cliente y dotes comunicativas. Debes tener mucho empuje e iniciativa.

Trabajarás con Adobe Analytics por lo que es necesario tener experiencia previa con esta herramienta, también seria necesario tener experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos. Y si posees conocimientos en el área de Marketing Digital, lenguajes de programación, Big Query o Business Intelligence ya estás muy cerca.

Te ofrecemos:


Contrato indefinido
Excelente ambiente de trabajo
Seguro médico privado
Amplio número de días de vacaciones
Horario flexible
Horario de verano (3 meses)
Posibilidad de teletrabajar (formato híbrido, 2 dias a la semana presenciales)
Formación continua (Linkedin Learning, Merkle University, etc)
Clases de inglés



Merkle does not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience. At the point of application, the candidate must have the legal right to work in Spain as we are unable to sponsor visas at this time.

As part of our Diversity and Inclusion agenda, and as an Equal Opportunities employer, if you require reasonable adjustments during the selection process please engage directly with your Recruiter.

Location:

Barcelona

Brand:

Merkle

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
In November of 2024, Printful and Printify came together as two equals and merged to form a global on-demand powerhouse. This role will involve working across our two platforms and brands, a unique and special challenge. To learn more about the merger, check out our blog post.

About The Role

Join us as a Data Quality Analyst, where your meticulous attention to finance data ensures the availability, completeness, and accuracy of essential information. Your primary focus will be on establishing efficient data retrieval processes and ensuring the highest quality of source data. You will be responsible for gathering all relevant financial data, ensuring its accuracy and prompt availability. A key part of your role will be developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, and conducting business tests to identify and resolve any issues.

Your Daily Tasks will Entail:


Maintain the accuracy of finance data in the data warehouse by developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, driving the resolution of identified errors
Collaborate with data engineers and business stakeholders to improve data pipelines
Develop source data tables for finance reporting needs and design scalable data models that facilitate accurate and insightful decision-making
Drive company-wide data accessibility by advocating for self-service data usage and utilizing BI tools such as Looker to empower teams with actionable insights
Keep processes organized and well-documented, contributing to process improvements and ensuring efficiency, particularly during month-end closing activities
Foster cross-functional collaboration by ensuring effective communication and alignment between finance and data teams, supporting seamless integration and cooperation



Your Qualifications:


At least 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Developer/Data Analyst
At least 2 years of experience building and enhancing Looker applications and administration
Well-versed in Python and SQL coding
Skills in data modeling and business logic processes
Experience with DWH design
Analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Able to work in a highly collaborative environment
Proactive attitude and ability to work independently, taking ownership of projects and delivering high-quality results within deadlines
Able to demonstrate knowledge of dimensional modeling, and data visualization techniques



What we Offer:


All the resources and tools to perform your tasks (choose between Mac or Windows)
An opportunity to work remotely or in a modern and welcoming office in Rīga
Flexible working hours (start your day as late as 11 a.m.)
Health insurance, including a mental wellness program
Employee discounts for 300+ premium products
Room for professional growth (conferences, workshops, mentoring, guest lectures)
Exciting team-building events and parties you’ll never forget!



We are an equal opportunity workplace. We’re committed to diversity and inclusion and make our hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and work experience.

Interested, but don’t think this is the right fit for you? Feel free to share it with friends and check out other open positions at our career's site. We’re always looking for creative and driven minds to join our ever-growing team.
Show more

Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more
