Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

• BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

• Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

• Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

• Power BI Experience;

• Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

• Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

• Fluent English (mandatory);

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Seeking a Data Analyst: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?

  • Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you’ll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
  • Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you’ll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
  • Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company’s culture.
  • Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you’re being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.

Perks Of Becoming a Rhino

  • You’ll get a welcome kit 📚
  • Opportunities for career progression 📈
  • Live on the edge with our health insurance 🏥
  • Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts 📺 🎵
  • Coverflex meal card 🍲 💳
  • Other protocols and special discounts ✨

For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • +5 years of experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime, etc;
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku;
  • Fluency in English (C1 Level) is mandatory;
  • Fluency in French (B2 Level) is a plus;
  • Availability for a hybrid work model in Porto office's.

Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

  • Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.


Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Descrição da Função

Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations. This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business. We are looking for a Data Analyst to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid). Requirements: -Between 3 to 6 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role; -Previous experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, or in a similar senior role; -Strong knowledge of business intelligence methodologies, particularly in data visualization (must have); -Proficiency in Power BI and experience in developing and managing BI reports; -Advanced SQL skills for data extraction, manipulation, and performance tuning; -Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and modeling; -Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical methods to support data-driven decision-making; -Excellent communication (both written and oral) and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly; -Good level of English (at least C1). We offer: - Health insurance; - A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary; - Constant feedback so you can grow professionally; - Remote onboarding process; - Team events every semester so you can live new adventures; - Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Localização


Porto, Portugal

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

Follow-up and coordination of scrum backlog features
Document the components and operation of application: Software Architecture, Technical Architecture and monitoring & alarmistic.
Have experience in L2 and L3 Support.
Good knowledge of scripting languages as Phyton or other data language.
Good knowledge of ticking system as Jira or service now.
Good knowledge of Power BI, Tableau.
Good knowledge of OLAP concepts, such as SSAS.
Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies.
Good knowledge of Data structures and algorithms.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / Data Analyst”.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Reporting & Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:




➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems




In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data & Reporting Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:

Coordinate the data collection, and take in charge data analysis and transformation (ETL), and production of the data necessary for reports.
Create and produce periodic or on-demand reports on Cybersecurity processes and data.
Ensure data quality and continuous improvement.
Take in charge some evolution topics.
Ensure the regular production of KPIs (which some of them are shared with the top management).
Ensure the quality of the produced KPIs.
Ensure that KPIs are adequately commented by the right stakeholders.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity or other relevant area for the position.
Very Good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
+3 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power BI is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability




📍 Hybrid role based in Porto.







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
If you excel in DATA, ALTEN has the team and project to take your career to the next level.

At ALTEN, we are certain that the success of our projects is due to the people who make up our team. That’s why, if you have at least 3-6 years of experience as a Data analyst, we are committed to boosting your talent, meeting your professional expectations, and making you feel right at home. Do you want to build the world of tomorrow today? Keep reading!

What would your main responsibilities be?

· Commitment to the job and the team objectives.

· Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.

· Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.

· Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.

· Aim to deliver very high-quality results.

· Respect the procedures, methodologies, and directives.

· Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.

· Good listening and questioning ability.

· Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.

· Good team working ability.

What are we looking for?

· Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or other relevant area for the position.

· Very good professional practice of English (French is a plus).

· At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.

· Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.

· Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory.

· Ability to be autonomous.

What can we offer you?

• Joining a competitive, multinational company that is constantly growing.

• Integration into a highly qualified team of professionals with a great work environment—innovative and dynamic.

• Specialized training and ongoing professional development.

• Social benefits and a Flexible Compensation Plan.

• Competitive salary.

Who are we?

We are a team. We are part of ALTEN, a European multinational specializing in providing consulting, information technology, and engineering services to the leading companies in the Spanish market.

Moreover, at ALTEN, we take pride in offering equal opportunities regardless of gender, age, abilities, or country of origin. Our commitment is to talent and to the people who possess it.

If you believe you are talented, apply now!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines – Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management – and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

Join the Data Sourcing Accounting Data team, within the Financial Data Integrity (FDI) division at Natixis, as part of the Finance Direction dedicated to upholding the integrity and accuracy of financial data across CIB activities (balance sheet and off-balance sheet). Our team is split between Paris and Porto, part of a department, of around 150 professionals, and is on the frontline of labelling financial data for both balance sheet and off-balance sheet activities.

Data Sourcing is split between Paris and Porto, and you'll be an integral part of a 10-member team.

You will be part of an integral part of a 10-member bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris.

As a Data Analyst, for of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:

  • Support Data quality initiatives to meet both internal standards and regulatory requirements, with a particular focus on ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of Critical Data Elements (CDEs). These efforts are crucial for enhancing the integrity of financial reporting and analysis across the institution.
  • Engaging in comprehensive data monitoring activities for Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) sectors, including Financing and Global Markets. Your analysis will support data-driven decision-making and operational excellence in these key areas.

You will be in contact with the Operations department (middle and back offices), the other teams of FDI & the internal Finance partners, and Finance IT teams.

Functions:

Monitoring and analysing data at the granular level to ensure the quality of the data required for all financial reporting or indicators (ALM, Solvency, Liquidity, FINREP,…):

  • Set up meetings with final internal partners to do a post-mortem of quarterly closing;
  • Study and propose new controls to be implemented or to evolve existing controls (especially completeness, existence, accuracy, consistency, or freshness controls):
  • Analyze the needs of the final internal partners;
  • Perform database queries to study the relevance of results;
  • Test and launch in production new controls.
  • Controlling the data acquisition & treatment on the financial chain inputs, along the flow;
  • Detecting anomalies & analyzing the root causes;
  • Reporting and alerting the management and the internal partners (accounting and ratio teams);
  • Defining remedial short and long term actions;
  • Writing and updating of operational procedures;
  • Support the data sourcing activities.

As a Data Analyst, you will be integral in ensuring the quality and integrity of data across all levels, crucial for financial reporting and compliance with indicators such as ALM, Solvency, Liquidity, and FINREP. Your responsibilities include:

  • Post-Mortem Meetings: Organize debrief sessions with key internal stakeholders after quarterly closings to review outcomes and identify improvement areas:
  • Control Evolution and Implementation:
  • Collaborate with internal partners to understand their data requirements and challenges;
  • Conduct database queries to assess the relevance of data and identify gaps, particularly focusing on Critical Data Elements (CDEs) to ensure their accuracy and completeness;
  • Develop, test, and deploy new controls or refine existing ones to enhance data completeness, existence, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness;
  • Data Acquisition & Treatment: Oversee the data collection and processing stages within the financial chain, ensuring smooth and error-free data flow.
  • Anomaly Detection: Proactively identify data discrepancies, delve into their root causes, and communicate findings with relevant teams, emphasizing the importance of managing CDEs effectively;
  • Communication: Report findings, anomalies, and recommendations to management and internal partners (accounting and ratio teams), fostering a culture of transparency and continuous improvement;
  • Action Planning: Develop both immediate and long-term remediation plans to address identified issues, ensuring the robustness of financial data;
  • Operational Documentation: Regularly review and update operational procedures to reflect current best practices and data management strategies;
  • Data Sourcing Support: Play a key role in assisting the Data Sourcing teams by:
  • Implementing automation strategies to streamline data retrieval and analysis processes.
  • Enhancing the efficiency and reliability of data sourcing activities, ensuring high-quality data is available for decision-making and reporting.

Additional information:

  • You will be part of a bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager Paris based, with regular interactions Paris team;
  • The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

  • Strong Background/Education in a quantitative discipline, with a professional experience as a Data or Business Analyst, preferably in the finance department of a mid / large cap company or audit;
  • Data or Business Analyst (notions);
  • Financial Products (advanced knowledge);
  • Data Viz & Data Prep Tools (Power BI, Tableau, Quicksight, Google Analytics, ...) (advanced knowledge);
  • Python (advanced knowledge);
  • SQL (advanced knowledge);
  • Microsoft Office (Excel, VBA, PowerPoint,…) (advanced knowledge);
  • Project Management (advanced knowledge);
  • Other Programming Languages (notions);
  • Fluent English and Good Level of French (a big plus).

Soft Skills:

  • Rigor and accuracy;
  • Ability to analyse, summarise and report;
  • Critical thinking, flexible and problem solving;
  • Personal commitment and team spirit;
  • Autonomy, curiosity, and willingness to move the issues forward.

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant’s gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze and interpret complex data sets to inform business decisions
Develop data models and algorithms to solve business challenges
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to improve business strategies
Create and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decisions
Ensure data quality and consistency across all data sources







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques
Ability to interpret and present complex data to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with big data technologies and databases (Hadoop, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Fluency in English (written and spoken)
French – Practice




📍 Hybrid role based in Porto







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx Developer)
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines – Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management – and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

As an Data Analyst, you will work alongside our Data Analysts, Data Engineers, BI Engineers, Business Analysts, Software Engineers, and others in the Application teams, from the specification to the implementation phase to improve our applications and business lines decisions. In addition, promote Data Centric mindset & Data Driven company.

Context / Team / Project:


Integrate into our Data Team (ETL, Data Management, BI), working together with Paris and Porto team members, as a unique team, and help Porto to upskill on this practice.
Bring a differentiating expertise to our clients and stakeholders with integrity and responsibility. (Sustainable impact)
Be agile, accountable, and resilient, according to the circumstances (Entrepreneurial mindset)
Purposely striving to succeed together, Porto and Paris, as one team with openness and confidence to improve knowledge, practice, framework, ecosystem (Collective intelligence).
Contribute on local initiative and project from awareness, assessment, use case identification, data preparation, implementation, industrialization…
Contribute to data community.


Main Tasks & Responsibilities:


Work closely with business users to understand their requirements to solve business problems.
Translate these requirements into an Alteryx workflow, working with other IT teams, local and otherwise, to make data processed and available for users.
Develop the workflows following the IT software development governance rules.
Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data projects.
Maintain and do the evolution of created assets during the projects.


Qualifications


4 Years of experience;
BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation
Proven Alteryx experience: + 2 years


Other Requirements:


Good communication.
Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive.
Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory)
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others, and an ability to turn ideas into realities.
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.


Nice to Have / Plus:


Other low code/no code tools like Power BI, Dataiku & Knime
SQL and VBA
Previous experience on financial area.
Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban)
French


Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant’s gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
Description:
Are you driven by Technology?

If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge!

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.It stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.

Red.It is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.

Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) !

What skills do you need to have?

Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.

4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.

Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.

Availability for occasional travel.

Fluency in English: French is highly valued.

Some of your responsibilities will be: Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.

Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.

Ensure compliance with software governance rules.

Estimate and manage data project tasks.

Red Code: A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking!

Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice.

Red Follow Up Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas?

No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out.

Red Hours Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone.

If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!

Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.

WHAT DRIVES YOU?

Apply here or through ****** and find out what moves us at

Title: Data Specialist
Description:
Local: Lisboa / Porto (Híbrido)

Descritivo Da Função

A Mind Source está a reforçar a sua Equipa de Business Insights com um Data Specialist

Perfil


Formação superior em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Software, Estatística, Matemática, Sistemas de Informação, Gestão, Economia ou áreas relacionadas;
Pelo menos 4 anos de experiência em BI, Análise de Dados ou Gestão de Informações, com atuação no desenvolvimento e gestão de projetos de BI, incluindo modelagem de dados, ETL e criação de dashboards;
Domínio de ferramentas de BI, com experiência obrigatória em Power BI e Airflow
Conhecimento avançado em SQL para manipulação e análise de dados


Quem Somos


Consultora de Tecnologias de Informação e Processos de Negócio
Expertise nas áreas de Business Insights, Web & Mobile Apps, Project & Program Leadership e Product Strategy & Development
17 anos experiência
+ 200 Talentos
Great Place to Work há 14 anos consecutivos
1º Lugar no ranking dos Best Workplaces IT Portugal 2024 – Melhor Empresa para Trabalhar em Portugal, no setor de IT - Distinguida pelo Great Place to Work Institute
41ª Melhor Empresa para Trabalhar na Europa 2023 – Distinguida pelo Great Place to Work Institute
Prémio Liderança e Desenvolvimento Humano - Distinguida pelo Great Place to Work Institute
Parceiros dos melhores fabricantes (SAS, OutSystems, Microsoft)
Prémio Inovação SAS
OutSystems Innovation Award


Porquê a Mind Source


Contrato de Trabalho
Formação profissional credenciada
Mentoring
Acompanhamento nos projetos e aconselhamento de carreira - Talent Management
Foco na progressão de carreira e crescimento
Desenvolvimento de projetos inovadores e aliciantes
Ambiente Jovem e Dinâmico


Benefícios Exclusivos


Seguro de Saúde
Mensalidade do Ginásio (Urban Sports Club)
Apoio jurídico-legal, nutricional e psicológico
Benefícios extrassalariais
E muito mais!


Somos uma marca da subholding Rumos Consulting, pertencente ao Grupo Rumos.

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
Who we are




Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer







A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.




What You Will Do




Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.




What you’ll bring




3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Show more

  • 3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
  • Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
  • In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
  • Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
  • Profound knowledge of the English language.


In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Analyst (French Speaker) | BPCE-SI
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines – Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management – and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Within the IT department of Natixis BPCE-SI, in Distribution et Data, within the Data Team Context:

Natixis is the corporate bank, of management, insurance and financial services of the Group BPCE, the second bank player in France with 36 million customers through its two networks, Banque Populaire and Caisse d'Epargne.

With more than 16 000 employees, Natixis intervenes in three fields of activity within which she(it) has strong business expertises:the Bank of Big Customers, the Savings and the Insurance and Specialized financial services. Corporate functions.

It accompanies in a long-lasting way, all over the world, its own clientele of companies, financial institutions and institutional investors and the private individual clients, professionals and SME of both networks of the Group BPCE.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. A strong background in data analysis, statistical methods, and data visualization is required. Work closely with various departments to gather data, analyze trends, and provide actionable insights to support business objectives.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection and Management:

Gather and clean data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external APIs.

Maintain and update databases to ensure data integrity and accessibility.

Data Analysis:

Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and correlations.

Use statistical techniques to interpret data and generate actionable insights.

Reporting:

Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to present findings to stakeholders.

Prepare visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel to communicate complex data in an understandable format.

Collaboration:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, and operations, to understand their data needs and provide support.

Collaborate with data engineers and other IT staff to improve data collection and processing methods.

Business Insights:

Provide recommendations based on data analysis to drive business strategies and improve performance.

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and report on progress towards goals.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization.

Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement solutions.

Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL,
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with statistical methods and data modeling techniques is a plus.
Must be french-speaker, at least C1


Additional Information

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.

Your Mission Will Be


Collaborate with stakeholders across various sectors to identify and understand their analytical needs and challenges;
Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for enhancement and customization;
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, ensuring they deliver actionable insights;
Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need


Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
Experience working with Snowflake and Azure Databricks;
Fluency in Portuguese and English;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have


BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
Experience working with SQL Server.


With Us You Can Be a


TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Data Engineer & Analyst
Description:
Sobre a Empresa: A Sysmatch é uma empresa de Consultoria e Outsourcing de IT com uma vasta gama de competências tecnológicas, resultantes da acumulação de know-how e da experiência dos nossos consultores, permitindo a implementação de soluções adaptadas às necessidades dos nossos clientes, privilegiando a sua robustez e expansão. Com mais de duas décadas no mercado, apresentamo-nos como uma empresa flexível, adaptável, inovadora e virada para o futuro.




Sobre o Cargo: Data Engineer & Analyst




Regime: Regime híbrido na Trofa




Descrição da Função: O candidato ideal terá um perfil híbrido, combinando capacidades técnicas de engenharia de dados com fortes competências analíticas e de negócio. Será responsável por desenvolver, gerir e otimizar pipelines de dados, bem como por realizar análises estratégicas para apoiar a tomada de decisão da empresa, lidando com vários stakeholders internos.

Responsabilidades:

Conceber, desenvolver e manter pipelines de dados eficientes e escaláveis.
Assegurar a qualidade, integridade e governança dos dados, garantindo a conformidade com os princípios de Data Governance.
Trabalhar com equipas de negócio para compreender requisitos e traduzir necessidades em soluções analíticas eficazes.
Criar e manter dashboards interativos e relatórios no Power BI para dar suporte à tomada de decisão.
Desenvolver modelos preditivos e análises de forecasting para otimizar processos e antecipar tendências.
Extrair, transformar e carregar (ETL) dados a partir de diferentes fontes e garantir a sua usabilidade para análises.
Automatizar processos de ingestão e tratamento de dados para melhorar a eficiência e reduzir tempos de resposta.
Garantir a segurança e conformidade dos dados, alinhando-se com as melhores práticas de proteção e privacidade.
Trabalhar com equipas multidisciplinares para implementar estratégias data-driven.

Requisitos:

Licenciatura/Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, Ciência de Dados, Gestão de Informação ou áreas relacionadas.
Experiência mínima de 2-3 anos em funções de Data Engineer, Data Analyst ou Business Intelligence.
Forte experiência em ferramentas de visualização e análise de dados, nomeadamente Power BI.
Conhecimentos sólidos de bases de dados relacionais e não relacionais
Experiência em processos de ETL e manipulação de grandes volumes de dados.
Domínio de linguagens de desenvolvimento para análise e manipulação de dados.
Conhecimento de princípios de Data Governance e melhores práticas de qualidade de dados (valorizam-se certificações)
Experiência na criação de modelos de previsão e análises estatísticas aplicadas ao negócio.
Capacidade de levantamento de requisitos e tradução de necessidades do negócio para soluções técnicas.
Boa capacidade de comunicação e interação com diferentes stakeholders.

O que te oferecemos:

Um projeto dinâmico num cliente bem-conceituado a nível Internacional;
Enquadramento salarial de acordo com a experiência demonstrada;
Evolução de carreira com intervenção em projetos tecnológicos ambiciosos e inovadores;
Integração em equipa dinâmica e heterogénea;
Acompanhamento personalizado a cada consultor;
Integração nos quadros Sysmatch com acesso a todas as atividades da empresa;
Serás parte das nossas formações e dos nossos eventos Team Building;
Uma rede de centenas de parcerias com empresas de inúmeros setores que te oferecem descontos exclusivos (saúde, bem-estar, viagens, gastronomia, cultura, lazer, formação, etc).




Processo de recrutamento, seleção e integração:

Os primeiros contactos serão realizados através de chamada telefónica ou vídeo conferência.

Estamos preparados para assegurar o acompanhamento e a integração dos novos colaboradores e apoiá-los nesta nova fase da sua carreira profissional.

Os primeiros contactos serão realizados através de chamada telefónica ou vídeo conferência.

Estamos preparados para assegurar o acompanhamento e a integração dos novos colaboradores e apoiá-los nesta nova fase da sua carreira profissional.

Title: Suporte Aplicacional - Business Intelligence
HTML:
Temos um desafio para ti –Suporte Aplicacional - Business Intelligence – Modelo Híbrido



O que procuramos:


- Formação Superior em Engenharia Informática;

- Experiência em Business Intelligence;

- Experiência com Data warehouse;

- Fortes conhecimentos de SQL / PLSQL;

- Experiência em Reporting (Microstrategy, Analysis services, outras similares);

- Experiência em ETL (Datastage, Databricks, SQL Server Integration Services, outras similares)

- Conhecimentos em Big Data (Hive, impala, spark, hbase, cloud – CDP, Oozie);

- Experiência com RAID;

- Experiência com Linguagens de programação (Shell script, python/pyspark) ;

- Experiência com Microsoft Azure.


O que oferecemos:


- Acesso a formação técnica e metodologias sólidas de avaliação de desempenho e gestão de carreiras;

- Perspetiva de crescimento de carreira a nível nacional e internacional;

- Parcerias nas áreas de Telecomunicações, Ensino, Turismo, Desporto e muito mais.

Title: Analista de Operações e Negócios (m/f/d)
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
A KINTO está à procura de um(a) Analista de Operações e Negócios talentoso(a) e motivado(a) para se juntar à nossa equipa em crescimento. Se tens paixão por análise de dados e queres contribuir para a otimização de operações num ambiente dinâmico e inovador, esta pode ser a tua oportunidade!




Os nossos desafios:




- Desenvolver análises detalhadas para otimizar processos operacionais, identificar oportunidades de melhoria e aumentar a eficiência

- Monitorizar e apresentar KPIs para suportar a tomada de decisões estratégicas

- Criar relatórios e dashboards dinâmicos usando ferramentas de Business Intelligence

- Propor e implementar melhorias contínuas nos processos para aumentar a eficiência, reduzir custos e gerir o pricing de serviços

- Participar ativamente na gestão de projetos estratégicos

- Colaborar com equipas internacionais da KINTO




O que valorizamos:




- Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Gestão, Engenharia, Economia, Matemática Aplicada ou áreas similares

- Experiência em funções semelhantes, preferencialmente nos setores de mobilidade, renting, leasing ou logística

- Domínio avançado de Excel e SQL e experiência em criação de dashboards em Power BI ou ferramentas similares

- Capacidade analítica, comunicação eficaz, trabalho em equipa, proatividade e iniciativa

- Fluência em Inglês




O que oferecemos:




- Integração numa empresa multinacional de referência no seu setor de atividade

- Remuneração adequada à função

- Diversos benefícios em vigor e a possibilidade de trabalhar num ambiente descontraído e sempre motivado




Porquê juntares-te à KINTO? Na KINTO acreditamos na inovação e na mobilidade sustentável. Oferecemos um ambiente de trabalho colaborativo, com oportunidades de crescimento e desenvolvimento contínuo. Se procuras fazer parte de uma empresa com impacto global e queres participar na transformação do setor da mobilidade, este é o lugar certo para ti.

Title: Personal Data Protection Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for Personal Data Protection Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Ensure group project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, and supporting Project Managers on their data protection activities".
Manage incoming external and internal requests in the outlook inbox CIB GDPR DESK, including Data Subject RightsRequests.
Publish the group GDPR DESK periodic report and manage a dedicated SharePoint space.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of personal data protection within group develop and share best practices with the data protection network.




Requirements:

Full proficiency of MSOffice suite Proficiency of project management tools and methodologies.
Language Skills Fluent English (C1-C2).
Excellent writing, communication and interpersonal skills Attention to detail and high sense of rigor and organization.
Ability to synthesize and simplify complex concepts to a senior audience.
Proactiveness and ability to leverage on transversal networks.
Ability to work in a changing environment / Adaptability.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/PersonalDataProtectionAnalyst”




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Reporting & Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:




➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems




In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data & Reporting Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:

Coordinate the data collection, and take in charge data analysis and transformation (ETL), and production of the data necessary for reports.
Create and produce periodic or on-demand reports on Cybersecurity processes and data.
Ensure data quality and continuous improvement.
Take in charge some evolution topics.
Ensure the regular production of KPIs (which some of them are shared with the top management).
Ensure the quality of the produced KPIs.
Ensure that KPIs are adequately commented by the right stakeholders.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity or other relevant area for the position.
Very Good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
+3 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power BI is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability




📍 Hybrid role based in Porto.







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
If you excel in DATA, ALTEN has the team and project to take your career to the next level.

At ALTEN, we are certain that the success of our projects is due to the people who make up our team. That’s why, if you have at least 3-6 years of experience as a Data analyst, we are committed to boosting your talent, meeting your professional expectations, and making you feel right at home. Do you want to build the world of tomorrow today? Keep reading!

What would your main responsibilities be?

· Commitment to the job and the team objectives.

· Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.

· Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.

· Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.

· Aim to deliver very high-quality results.

· Respect the procedures, methodologies, and directives.

· Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.

· Good listening and questioning ability.

· Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.

· Good team working ability.

What are we looking for?

· Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or other relevant area for the position.

· Very good professional practice of English (French is a plus).

· At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.

· Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.

· Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory.

· Ability to be autonomous.

What can we offer you?

• Joining a competitive, multinational company that is constantly growing.

• Integration into a highly qualified team of professionals with a great work environment—innovative and dynamic.

• Specialized training and ongoing professional development.

• Social benefits and a Flexible Compensation Plan.

• Competitive salary.

Who are we?

We are a team. We are part of ALTEN, a European multinational specializing in providing consulting, information technology, and engineering services to the leading companies in the Spanish market.

Moreover, at ALTEN, we take pride in offering equal opportunities regardless of gender, age, abilities, or country of origin. Our commitment is to talent and to the people who possess it.

If you believe you are talented, apply now!

Description:

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.Red.It stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.Red.It is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Our Team as a Data Analyst in Porto, Portugal! 🌍

Who Are We?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.

Where’s the Action?

Our office in Porto – a vibrant hub of innovation and culture, where great things happen every day!

What is my department like?

The Data Analytics team works closely with the Senior Management Team to accelerate data-driven decision-making. At the same time, we empower other teams by helping them work with key metrics and define meaningful visualisations. We are the heart of transforming raw data into actionable insights that fuel business growth!

What is my role like?

As a Data Analyst you will turn raw data into powerful insights! You’ll help shaping data-driven strategies, create impactful visualisations, collaborate with teams to optimise business performance, and design scalable data structures—all while leveraging cutting-edge technologies like Python, SQL, AWS, and Power BI.

What will my daily tasks involve?

✓ Process, model, and create data visualisations using programming languages and analytics technologies, including but not limited to Python, SQL, AWS (Redshift, S3, SageMaker, Glue), Power BI, etc.

✓ Understand the business and how key numbers and KPIs connect day-to-day operations to the company’s future outcomes.

✓ Collaborate with various teams (e.g. Commercial, Management) to identify information needs and support operational areas in optimising business performance through data models.

✓ Define data structure requirements for analytics to help design data flows and processing pipelines.

What is expected from me?

✓ Experience using tools for data cleaning and processing, such as Python, SQL, Git, AWS/GCP/Azure tools, Data Lakes, among others.

✓ Proficiency in data modelling and visualisation using Power BI.

✓ Ability to select and utilise appropriate visualisation models to enhance data interpretation from a business perspective.

✓ Agility in understanding and assimilating business concepts, identifying key challenges, and translating them into technical solutions.

✓ 3+ years of experience, with a passion for and capability in hands-on technical implementation of analyses and models.

What’s in It for You at Clever?

💰 Competitive Remuneration Package – Because you deserve the best!

💊 Health Insurance – Because your health matters!

🎉 Happiness Department & E.A.P. – Holistic well-being and unlimited online psychology sessions with our in-house therapist.

🎂 Birthday Leave – Take the day off — it’s all about you!

🥗 Cafeteria with Healthy Options – We're feeders, sorry!

📚 Continuous Learning Culture– Clever Academy and language classes.


and so much more!


At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed

Ready to make a Clever Choice? 🚀
Show more
